channel.title: New Build
channel.description:
I have a budget of about $500 dollars, this is what I came up with.\ I'll use it for a bit of graphic design and a bit of gaming (TF2 mainly)
COOLER MASTER ELITE 335 RC-335-KKN1-GP Black SECC Steel ATX Mid Tower Computer Case - Retail Item #: N82E16811119161 $39.99 GIGABYTE GA-MA770T-UD3P AM3 AMD 770 ATX AMD Motherboard Item #: N82E16813157161 $79.99 POWERCOLOR AX4850 512MD3-PH Radeon HD 4850 512MB 256-bit GDDR3 PCI Express 2.0 x16 HDCP Ready CrossFire Supported Video Card - Retail Item #: N82E16814131162 $99.99 Rosewill RP600V2-S-SL 600W ATX12V v2.01 SLI Ready Power Supply - Retail Item #: N82E16817182032 $59.99 G.SKILL 4GB (2 x 2GB) 240-Pin DDR3 SDRAM DDR3 1333 (PC3 10666) Dual Channel Kit Desktop Memory Model F3-10666CL9D-4GBNQ - Retail Item #: N82E16820231190 $77.99 AMD Phenom II X3 720 2.8GHz Socket AM3 95W Triple-Core Black Processor Model HDZ720WFGIBOX - Retail Item #: N82E16819103649 $119.00 Grand Total: $496.95

item.title: New Build
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“RXVL, post:21, topic:298940”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=395293.msg2942443#msg2942443 date=1251988466]

Don’t skimp on the PSU, get something better than Rosewill.

It’s not really going to hurt anything, one day it might burn out and he will have to get a new one, or he might never have a problem.
[/quote]

Or it could burn out and take the mobo with it, it’s happened to me before with cheap PSU’s.[/quote]

I’ve had a lot of cheap PSU’s burn out, 2 with this computer that I am on alone, but I’ve never had it take anything else with it.

Read full topic

It’s not really going to hurt anything, one day it might burn out and he will have to get a new one, or he might never have a problem.[/quote]

item.title: New Build
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

Gigabyte make real quality motherboards, with quality pieces on them. Usually more expensive them the other parties, but far more durable.

Read full topic

item.title: New Build
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

My friend likes gigabyte, I have never used them but I hear good things, so I certainly think it is a better decision than ASRock. I still always go MSI though.

Read full topic

item.title: New Build
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

I have used a lot of asrock they seem to break faster but value is good but I fot my own pc would go for asus or msi as mitb suggested

Read full topic

item.title: New Build
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

Alright, I picked out another MoBo,

newegg.com

GIGABYTE GA-MA770T-UD3P AM3 AMD 770 ATX AMD Motherboard - Newegg.com

Buy GIGABYTE GA-MA770T-UD3P AM3 AMD 770 ATX AMD Motherboard with fast shipping and top-rated customer service.Once you know, you Newegg!

Only one I could find with the things I needed in that price range.

Read full topic

item.title: New Build
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

what mitb said, pick any motherboard brand except asrock, and possibly asus. Gigabyte would be the best quality mobo’s.

Read full topic

item.title: New Build
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:8, topic:298940”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=395293.msg2937656#msg2937656 date=1251655314]
I would strongly recommend against ASRock mobos, after a few months the sound mysteriously stops working, then other components mysteriously stop working, until you have to get a new motherboard. It has happened twice to me with different computers, I always go with MSI and to this day have never had 1 problem.
[/quote]

But the MoBo has a lot of good reviews.

newegg.com

Computer Parts, PC Components, Laptop Computers, LED LCD TV, Digital Cameras and...

Newegg.com offers the best prices on computer products, laptop computers, LED LCD TVs, digital cameras, electronics, unlocked phones, office supplies, and more with fast shipping and top-rated customer service. Newegg shopping upgraded ™

It just strikes me as not being too cheap, and you could get a quality one for the same price or cheaper.

Read full topic

item.title: New Build
item.dc:creator: @933pm 933pm
item.description:
@933pm wrote:

Only $500? I haven’t bought any new parts in a while… if stuff is this cheap now then I think I’ll build a new one as well

Read full topic

item.title: New Build
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I would strongly recommend against ASRock mobos, after a few months the sound mysteriously stops working, then other components mysteriously stop working, until you have to get a new motherboard. It has happened twice to me with different computers, I always go with MSI and to this day have never had 1 problem.

But the MoBo has a lot of good reviews.

newegg.com

ASRock M3A780GXH/128M AM3 AMD 780G HDMI ATX AMD Motherboard - Newegg.com

Buy ASRock M3A780GXH/128M AM3 AMD 780G HDMI ATX AMD Motherboard with fast shipping and top-rated customer service.Once you know, you Newegg!
